title: Plane slips off runway and crashes at Kathmandu airport, killing 18
content: The Saurya Airlines plane was taking off from Nepal’s Tribhuvan International Airport runway when it flipped, eyewitnesses said. A child is among the dead.
summary: The Saurya Airlines plane was taking off from Nepal’s Tribhuvan International Airport runway when it flipped, eyewitnesses said. A child is among the dead.

title: How ‘carbon cowboys’ are cashing in on protected Amazon forest
content: A six-month investigation reveals that many carbon credit ventures reap profits from public lands they have no right to and fail to share revenue with those protecting the forest.
summary: A six-month investigation reveals that many carbon credit ventures reap profits from public lands they have no right to and fail to share revenue with those protecting the forest.

title: Taiwan braces for Typhoon Gaemi, set to be the most severe in eight years
content: The powerful storm has already caused deaths and devastation in the Philippines and is now bearing down on Taiwan, where emergency measures are in place.
summary: The powerful storm has already caused deaths and devastation in the Philippines and is now bearing down on Taiwan, where emergency measures are in place.

title: Maduro’s decade of authoritarian rule: A visual timeline
content: How Venezuela’s socialist strongman took and consolidated power — and why the opposition now sees cause for hope.
summary: How Venezuela’s socialist strongman took and consolidated power — and why the opposition now sees cause for hope.

title: Sharks test positive for cocaine in Brazil’s drug-polluted waters
content: Brazilian sharpnose sharks found with cocaine in their livers and muscles highlight the impact of the illegal drug trade on marine life, scientists say.
summary: Brazilian sharpnose sharks found with cocaine in their livers and muscles highlight the impact of the illegal drug trade on marine life, scientists say.

title: As Netanyahu addresses Congress, agony in Gaza endures
content: The first time Netanyahu addressed Congress was nearly three decades ago. Now, he arrives in the U.S. amid devastation in Gaza and discontent in Israel.
summary: The first time Netanyahu addressed Congress was nearly three decades ago. Now, he arrives in the U.S. amid devastation in Gaza and discontent in Israel.

title: China brokers Palestinian unity declaration in bid to be global mediator
content: Though unlikely to paper over the deep differences between Hamas and Fatah, it represents China’s push into a traditionally U.S. area of influence.
summary: Though unlikely to paper over the deep differences between Hamas and Fatah, it represents China’s push into a traditionally U.S. area of influence.

title: Alleged rape of Australian rattles Paris days before Olympics
content: Officials had said the French capital would be “the safest place in the world” when the Olympic Games began this summer.
summary: Officials had said the French capital would be “the safest place in the world” when the Olympic Games began this summer.

title: Olympic costs can crush host cities. Paris 2024 vowed cheaper Games.
content: Paris may avert the financial disasters of past Olympics, although its budget is bigger than expected and the benefits remain uncertain.
summary: Paris may avert the financial disasters of past Olympics, although its budget is bigger than expected and the benefits remain uncertain.

title: Netanyahu’s history of clashing with U.S. presidents spans decades
content: As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu returns to Washington this week, here is a look back at some of his most notable clashes with U.S. presidents.
summary: As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu returns to Washington this week, here is a look back at some of his most notable clashes with U.S. presidents.

title: Canada’s popular Jasper National Park ordered to evacuate as fire nears
content: An emergency alert warned residents and guests that they must be out by 3 a.m., with instructions to leave via the one remaining open highway.
summary: An emergency alert warned residents and guests that they must be out by 3 a.m., with instructions to leave via the one remaining open highway.

title: India’s indie films win awards abroad but find no space in theaters at home
content: The nation’s parallel cinema is racking up Oscars and awards at Cannes but distributors give them little play in India, claiming the audience is too small.
summary: The nation’s parallel cinema is racking up Oscars and awards at Cannes but distributors give them little play in India, claiming the audience is too small.

title: Why does China care about a rust bucket in the middle of the sea?
content: Beijing and Manila have struck a provisional deal to allow the resupply of the dilapidated Sierra Madre in the South China Sea, which has become a potential conflict point.
summary: Beijing and Manila have struck a provisional deal to allow the resupply of the dilapidated Sierra Madre in the South China Sea, which has become a potential conflict point.

title: Ukraine confronts labor shortage as need for soldiers drains workforce
content: Ukraine’s urgent need for soldiers to fight Russia’s invasion is eroding the workforce and creating a drag on the economy but also new opportunities for women.
summary: Ukraine’s urgent need for soldiers to fight Russia’s invasion is eroding the workforce and creating a drag on the economy but also new opportunities for women.

title: Israel orders evacuation of former Gaza safe area; U.N. aid convoy fired on
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu traveled to Washington, where the political turmoil was creating further uncertainty about U.S.-Israeli relations.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu traveled to Washington, where the political turmoil was creating further uncertainty about U.S.-Israeli relations.

title: Russia sentences Russian American journalist to more than 6 years
content: The sentencing of Alsu Kurmasheva, an editor with Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, occurred the same day that Wall Street Journal’s Evan Gershkovich was sentenced on espionage charges.
summary: The sentencing of Alsu Kurmasheva, an editor with Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, occurred the same day that Wall Street Journal’s Evan Gershkovich was sentenced on espionage charges.
